org.tango.settingsmanager

Class SettingsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tango.settingsmanager.SettingsManager

  • public class SettingsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    SettingsManager class description: This idea is to standardize and centralize the settings management for the control system. It will have to be accessible from client applications and servers written in C++, Java or Python. The most flexible system to store the settings is to use files on disk. Users will be able to manage sub system, copies or edition (device/attribute renaming). All settings files will be store under a $SETTINGS_ROOT directory. A subdirectory will be created for each accelerator system. To be accessible from all languages, a TANGO class will manage read, write and apply settings for attributes. Each instance of this class will manage a system (SRRF, RIPS, LINAC, ...) files under its own subdirectory fixed by a TANGO property. This class will be able to: - Write a settings file with an optional list of attribute as input argument. This class will be responsible to do not write above its subdirectory. - Get file content to preview file with string as output argument. - Apply settings to attributes. - Read a settings file and return content in a pipe (att1 name, att1 value, att2 name, att2 value, ...)

      • GenerateSettingsFile

        public void GenerateSettingsFile(java.lang.String[] generateSettingsFileIn)
                          throws fr.esrf.Tango.DevFailed
        Execute command "GenerateSettingsFile". description: the device will generate a settings file for specified attributes
        Parameters:
        generateSettingsFileIn - This array must contain file name. If no attributes are defined as property, it must contain attribute names. It can also contain author names and comments. Each element needs to start with: FILE: for file name ATTRIBUTE: for each attribute name AUTHOR: for author name COMMENTS: for comments
        Throws:
        fr.esrf.Tango.DevFailed - if command execution failed.
